headline.print_headline: If You Feel O.K., Maybe You Are O.K.
headline.seo: Overdiagnosis as a Flaw in Health Care
headline.main: If You Feel O.K., Maybe You Are O.K.

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof H Gilbert Welch on rumblings within the medical profession suggesting that enthusiasm for early diagnosis may be waning; asserts while screening saves a few lives, it also drags many others into the system needlessly--needless appointments, tests, drugs and operations that make money for pharmaceutical companies, hospitals and doctors but do little more than cause anxiety for patients; holds that medicine must move back toward its original mission of helping sick patients, and letting the healthy be.
docs.lead_paragraph: Is looking hard for things to be wrong a good way to promote health?
docs.snippet: Is looking hard for things to be wrong a good way to promote health?

docs.lead_paragraph: YESNER--Dr. Raymond, M.D. Lung tumor expert, 97, died at home February 8, 2012. He was Professor Emeritus and former Associate Dean at the Yale School of Medicine, and a former Director of Anatomical Pathology and Chief of Staff and Lab Services in the VA Hospital system. Dr. Yesner was an expert witness in landmark cases brought against the cigarette industry for the health effects of smoking. He was author and editor of the WHO International Classification of Lung Tumors and a former Chair of the WHO Expert Committee on Lung Cancer As a researcher and educator, Dr. Yesner received the Lifetime Achievement Award of the Pulmonary Pathology Society and the International Academy of Pathology Gold Medal. He was preceded in death by Bernice, his loving wife of 62 years, and is survived by his three children and four grandchildren. A memorial will be held in Brady Hall, 310 Cedar St., New Haven, CT, 2:00pm, March 12.
